newsitem.title: USA: Printrak to buy mug shot systems supplier.
newsitem.headline: Printrak to buy mug shot systems supplier.

text.p: Printrak International Inc, a supplier of automated fingerprint identification systems, said it agreed to acquire TFP Inc, which supplies digital mug shot systems used by law enforcement, jail and correctional agencies.

PrinTrak said would issue 1.4 million common shares in the deal, which would be accounted for as a pooling of interest. The transaction was subject to certain conditions and was expected to be completed by the end of April, it said.
Under the agreement, TFP would retain its name, facilities, management and staff while operating as a Printrak subsidiary under the direction of Barry White, TFP president.

"We foresee TFP continuing to be a powerful leader in its niche markets while at the same time fitting perfectly into Printrak's strategy of providing more complete solutions in the larger market of integrated criminal justice information systems, further extending our leadership position in this market," Printrak Chief Executive Richard Giles said. ((New York newsdesk 212-859-1610))
